text.p: These are some of the leading stories in the Jordanian press on Sunday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Latest crisis vindicates Jordanian position on Jerusalem, King tells cabinet. Jordan ready to cooperate with Palestinians on every step to face challenges to peace process.
- Jordan working with Saudi Arabia to resolve Qatar-Bahrain dispute before ruling by World Court.
- Royal Decree commutes death sentences passed on "Arab Afghans" to life terms.
- Hamas calls on government to free "Islamist and nationalist" activists.
Jordan gets invitation to MENA conference.
Arafat and Netanyahu said to meet on Sunday followed by a summit with Mubarak and the king.
- King Hussein says sovereignty over Jerusalem is not an issue for bargaining. "The whole peace process is in danger if it does not resume in a sincere way with honesty and commitment."
- Britain supports king Hussein's suggestion to form an international committee to supervise sensitive issues in Jersualem.
- Parliament rejects Israeli measures in Jerusalem and supports Jordanian stand.
- King Hussein says Jordan insists on implementing agreements with Israel without questioning them.
- Parliament rejects Israeli violations in Jerusalem.
- October 21 set as date for reopening parliament.
- International moves to support king Hussein's initiative to protect holy sites in Jerusalem.
- King Hussein says there will be no change in government under pressure.
